channel.title: JSON and item definitions?

item.title: JSON and item definitions?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

I encountered the same problem you did when starting out with JSON. Great choice, you won’t regret because it’s fast and extremely easy to parse. Here is how write global items, if it helps at all.

[ { "id": 995, "amount": 1000, "x": 3096, "y": 3243, "z": 0, "respawns": true }, { "id": 995, "amount": 1500, "x": 3097, "y": 3243, "z": 0, "respawns": true } ]

Read full topic

item.title: JSON and item definitions?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

use [] for lists and {} for properties. i’d say it should look like this:

{
"Item Definitions": [
    "scimitar": {
       "standAnim": 100,
       "walkAnim": 100,
    },
    "dlong": {
       "standAnim": 90,
       "walkAnim": 85,
    }
]
}

Read full topic

item.title: JSON and item definitions?
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

Could someone provide me with a small example of how the format goes?
I’ve just gotten started learning this language and i’m not exactly sure how to go about ‘if’ statements, or if you can even do that in json. google was no help.

mostly confused about what to do with weapons with special anims and how to handle the attack styles

{"Item Definitions": {
    "scimitar": {
       "standAnim": 100,
       "walkAnim": 100,
    }
}
}

Read full topic
